The conclusion I took from it was that if we happen to remove the include from `foo_private.hh`, we would immediately notice because we break `foo.cc`.  And unlike being broken by missing includes from a third party, being broken by your headers, private or not, could indicate something useful? I can't think of an example...

Anyway, I don't think this is a big deal. I just felt it was redundant, and the pull request description said it was "removing unnecessary statements where possible" :smile:
